section_title: Removal of loose body (Evidence: pg no: 30, L1096)
names: Removal of loose body (Evidence: pg no: 30, L1096)
description: Removal of loose body is considered medically necessary when BOTH of the following are present. (Evidence: pg no: 30, L1097)
scope: This guideline addresses hip arthroscopy when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture. (Evidence: pg no: 28, L993-L994)

documentation: Radiographic evidence of acute, post-traumatic, intra-articular foreign body or displaced fracture fragment larger than the size of an arthroscopy cannula (5 mm or larger) (Evidence: pg no: 30, L1098-L1099)
Hip pain associated with grinding, catching, locking, or popping, and exam findings confirm pain with limited range of motion (Evidence: pg no: 30, L1100-L1101)

exclusions: Removal of loose body for Kellgren-Lawrence grade 4 osteoarthritis (Evidence: pg no: 31, L1104)
